content: cherry blossom flower pattern abbreviations this pattern uses american terminology chain - chain slip_stitch - slip_stitch yo - yarn over single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet tc - triple crochet csdc - chainless starting double_crochet this is a great tutorial fdc - foundation double_crochet ftc - foundation triple crochet fc - foundation chain - the chain part of a foundation stitch along the edge this is the place you insert your hook to make your next foundation stitch ttc - tethered tc - this is a tc with the first yo wrapped around the chain 2 space this helps keep the first tc close to the chain 2 space rather than leaving a gap step by step instructions yo around chain 2 space yo insert hook into next tc and pull up a loop yo pull through the first 2 loops yo pull through 2 loops yo pull through the final two loops pattern chain 6 slip_stitch to first st 1 10 single_crochet around chain slip_stitch to first st 10 single_crochet 2 csdc chain 2 **tc chain 2** x9 slip_stitch to first st 10 sts 10 chain 2 spaces a i find the cstc to be too awkward instead i just pull the initial loop up to about tc height rather than double_crochet 3 in this round you will make 5 petals each petal consists of a right side with foundation stitches to make the center of it and a left side that works back down the foundation stitches a ttc 2 tc in next tc this is the initial st b ftc in the same tc then 2 more tc in the fc you just made c fdc double_crochet slip_stitch around prev double_crochet slip_stitch into fc chain 2 2 double_crochet d working along the other side 3 tc in next fc e 3 tc in initial st when you make the last tc wrap the yarn around the hook twice and insert into the initial st as usual then yo around the chain 2 space and pull through the first two loops yo and pull through next two loops and yo around the chain 2 space again and pull through final two loops slip_stitch to next tc repeat around slip_stitch to first st and cut yarn weave in ends
